newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midwest hogs seen $0.50-$1.00 lower - trade.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midwest hogs seen $0.50-$1.00 lower - trade.

text.p: Midwest direct cash hog prices early Thursday were seen $0.50 to $1.00 per cwt lower, pressured by larger-than-expected interior hog receipts and a slump in pork product demand, livestock dealers said.
Interior Iowa/southern Minnesota hog receipts Tuesday totaled 110,000 head, well above that day's estimate of 100,000. Wednesday's estimate was 100,000 head.

Tops in Iowa and Minnesota on hogs delivered to plants were expected at $58.50 per cwt and Illinois hogs could have a top of $58.00. Indiana buyers expect prices to fall $0.50 to $1.00, with a top of $57.00 to $57.50.
Larger marketings were resulting in expanded pork production at about the same time that demand moved into a slump, market sources said.
Wholesale pork prices at midday were quoted by USDA $2.00 to $4.00 lower for fresh pork bellies and $2.00 lower for loins. Values by the end of the day could be even lower, market sources said.
USDA estimated hog slaughter Wednesday at 348,000 head, which brought the week to date figure to 1.008 million, up 1.0 percent from a week ago and down 1.9 percent from a year ago.
